# **10  Visual Statistical Analysis**

## **10.3 Getting Started**

#### 10.3.1 Installing and launching R packages

```{r}
pacman::p_load(ggstatsplot, tidyverse)
```

### 10.3.2 Importing data

```{r}
#| message: false
exam <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")
```

#### 10.3.3 One-sample test: gghistostats() method

```{r}
set.seed(1234)

gghistostats(
  data = exam,
  x = ENGLISH,
  type = "bayes",
  test.value = 60,
  xlab = "English scores"
)
```

### 10.3.6 Two-sample mean test: ggbetweenstats()

Two-sample mean test of Maths scores by gender

```{r}
ggbetweenstats(
  data = exam,
  x = GENDER, 
  y = MATHS,
  type = "np",
  messages = FALSE
)
```

### 10.3.7 Oneway ANOVA Test: ggbetweenstats() method

-   “ns” → only non-significant

-   “s” → only significant

-   “all” → everything

[**pairwise.display = "s"**]{.underline}

```{r}
ggbetweenstats(
  data = exam,
  x = RACE, 
  y = ENGLISH,
  type = "p",
  mean.ci = TRUE, 
  pairwise.comparisons = TRUE, 
  pairwise.display = "s",
  p.adjust.method = "fdr",
  messages = FALSE
)
```

[**pairwise.display = "ns"**]{.underline}

```{r}
ggbetweenstats(
  data = exam,
  x = RACE, 
  y = ENGLISH,
  type = "p",
  mean.ci = TRUE, 
  pairwise.comparisons = TRUE, 
  pairwise.display = "ns",
  p.adjust.method = "fdr",
  messages = FALSE
)
```

[**pairwise.display = "all"**]{.underline}

```{r}
ggbetweenstats(
  data = exam,
  x = RACE, 
  y = ENGLISH,
  type = "p",
  mean.ci = TRUE, 
  pairwise.comparisons = TRUE, 
  pairwise.display = "all",
  p.adjust.method = "fdr",
  messages = FALSE
)
```

### 10.3.8 Significant Test of Correlation: ggscatterstats()

```{r}
ggscatterstats(
  data = exam,
  x = MATHS,
  y = ENGLISH,
  marginal = FALSE,
  )
```

#### 10.3.9 Significant Test of Association (Depedence) : ggbarstats() methods

```{r}
exam1 <- exam %>% 
  mutate(MATHS_bins = 
           cut(MATHS, 
               breaks = c(0,60,75,85,100))
)
```

```{r}
ggbarstats(exam1, 
           x = MATHS_bins, 
           y = GENDER)
```
